channel.title: Zeroday on pegielm
channel.description: Recent content in Zeroday on pegielm

item.title: fifology writeup
item.description: Challenge description In the age of old, before the Stack-mages seized dominion over enchanted devices, only a select few possessed the wisdom to unravel the mysteries of the arcane queue language. files : program.fo documentation.md Solution we can seperate the code into parts: PUSH 0; PUSH 6; PUSH 102; PUSH 108; PUSH 97; PUSH 103; PUSH 58; PUSH 32; SYSCALL; prints flag: PUSH 244; PUSH 100; PUSH 224; PUSH 108; PUSH 192; PUSH 92; PUSH 230; PUSH 116; PUSH 202; PUSH 43; PUSH 210; PUSH 105; PUSH 178; PUSH 101; PUSH 162; PUSH 13; PUSH 37; PUSH 78; PUSH 182; PUSH 78; PUSH 166; PUSH 84; PUSH 154; PUSH 72; PUSH 168; PUSH 72; PUSH 168; PUSH 76; PUSH 178; PUSH 68; PUSH 146; PUSH 70; PUSH 166; PUSH 92; PUSH 0; PUSH 34; this part of the code is a flag chars before decryption.

item.title: in the dark writeup
item.description: Challenge description A lone mage, lost in the abyss of darkness awaits aid. Only a experienced wizard can guide him, perceiving what mortal eyes cannot see… files : chall or you can build it from source: source.c you need to compile it with: gcc source.c -lssl -lcrypto -o chall Solution open chall in ida in move_right() function (or any other) there is variable ‘MAP’ after inspecting the ‘MAP’ (right click -> array -> turn off ‘Use dup construnct’) we can see (or in gdb ‘x/100x (int*)&MAP’):

item.title: mov it mov it writeup
item.description: Challenge description Oh no! The poor mage has stumbled upon a massive stone blocking his path. If only there was someone who knew a spell to mov it… files : chall or you can build it from source: source.c but you need to compile it with movuscator :) movcc -Wf--no-mov-flow source.c -o chall Solution run chall in gdb set breakpoint on puts (b *puts) (other breakpoints probably also work, puts is visible in the debugger)
